facts.1: International Kissing Day started in the United Kingdom and is now celebrated worldwide.
facts.2: The day is meant to celebrate the simple act of a kiss and its importance in social bonds.
facts.3: Kissing can be a litmus test for a relationship; studies show that the frequency and style of kissing are indicators of relationship satisfaction.

facts.1: Jan Hus was a Czech theologian and philosopher who became a church reformer and an inspiration to Protestantism.
facts.2: Jan Hus Day is a public holiday in the Czech Republic, commemorating his martyrdom on July 6, 1415.
facts.3: Hus is considered a national hero in the Czech Republic, and his death is seen as a symbol of strength against oppressive regimes.

facts.1: National Fried Chicken Day celebrates the American culinary tradition of fried chicken.
facts.2: The origins of fried chicken in the USA can be traced back to Scottish immigrants and African slaves.
facts.3: Fried chicken has become a staple in American fast-food and is recognized for its crunchy texture and flavorful spices.
